final_answer:
The image humorously contrasts two concepts: the abundance of scooters and the poor condition of the road they're meant to be used on. The text "YES, BUT" highlights a common satirical point regarding urban planning or infrastructure issues. 

"YES" refers to the availability of scooters for transportation, symbolizing progress or modern transport solutions. "BUT" introduces the obstacle—the cracked, pothole-filled road—making it impractical to use the scooters effectively. The satire lies in the irony of providing a modern solution without addressing fundamental infrastructure problems, rendering the scooters almost useless.
